e="preserve">Blake Heron (January 11, 1982 – September 8, 2017) was an American actor. He starred as Marty Preston in the 1996 movie "Shiloh". He was born in Sherman Oaks, California. He also appeared in "Cheaters", "Boston Public" (2000), "Family Law" (1999) and "The Guardian", he took on the role of Specialist Galen Bungum in "We Were Soldiers" (2002). He also appeared in "Dandelion" (2004).
Heron was found dead at his apartment by his girlfriend in Los Angeles, California on September 8, 2017, aged 35. In the days before his death, he was recovering from his heroin addiction and suffered from the flu.
